Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2008 04:29PM lori1964 wrote: I had a mild case last summer and kept it under control.  It gave me problems this summer.  I still have pain once in awhile.  It's normal and it will go away but it will come back once in awhile too. When my shoulder/arm hurts I elavate it with a pillow.  I also stretch it out.. You should be stretching your arm everyday.  I learned a few weeks ago that I sleep with my arms curled up that is a problem when you LE.  I have learned to start out sleeping with my arm elavated.  It has seemed to help.  Hope it get s better.

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2007 09:58AM lori1964 wrote: I didn't have any pain with my lumpectomy.. I was actually surprised that it didn't hurt any.. But you'll be fine.. Just take your pain pills.

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2008 08:27PM lori1964 wrote: Thanks for the responses... My hand therapist works stictly with lymphdema patients.. I think it just shocked her about my side because the way my progress has went with my therapy that where my pain is it shouldn't be.  I get the complete work over from my therapist.. When I see her I am with her about 45 mintues to an hour.. She also runs the pump on my arm.  I am just trying to believe that the pain I am feeling is because of some kind of fluid sitting there.. I am just glad tomorrow is Tuesday and that I'm going.... So many thoughts run through my mind.. Thanks for the support.......
Posts.Title: Lymphedema Scared lori1964 cnewberry55

Posts.Content: lori1964 wrote: I have been going to a hand therapist since June 26 of this summer.  I had a slight case of Lymphedema last summer and it showed up again this summer.  Last month after she did my treatment as I was  getting in the car my side hurt so bad.  Now I when I say side I mean about 5 inches below my arm pit.  It was like fluids were moving and it was hurting in that spot.. Well the next week it happened again.  I mentioned it to her and the look on her face lead me to believe that, that shouldn't be happening.. she suggested I talk to my oncologist when I see him in Dec.  Well I have freaked myself about what it could be and I am seeing my Rad Doctor Tuesday about it.. I have scared myself into believing that my cancer has come back.. It's a dull pain, just enough for me to freak out about it.. I haven't been freaked out for along time...  I was just wondering if anyone else has expierenced pain in the side from lymphedema.  I am hoping it's just fluids but everywhere I look for information it only explains the fluids laying in the arm or armpit..   Any input would be appreciated..  I went through Chemo June 2006 to Sept. 2006. Then 7 weeks of radiation.. So it's been almost two years since radiation.. I want to believe that it's still side affects but not sure.. Dx 5/5/2006, 3cm, Stage IIB, 9/15 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lymphedema Scared lori1964 cnewberry55
